member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMMP.AddCHMMPResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: The ARN of the media pipeline that you want to tag. Consists of he pipeline's endpoint region, resource ID, and pipeline ID.

para.para: The ARN of the media pipeline associated with any tags. The ARN consists of the pipeline's endpoint region, resource ID, and pipeline ID.
The tags associated with the specified media pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMMP.AddCHMMPResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.ChimeSDKMediaPipelines.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMMP.AddCHMMPResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceARN parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceARN' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMMP.AddCHMMPResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMMP.GetCHMMPMediaCapturePipelineCmdlet
member.summary: Gets an existing media pipeline.

para.para: The ID of the pipeline that you want to get.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMMP.GetCHMMPMediaCapturePipelineCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'MediaCapturePipeline'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.ChimeSDKMediaPipelines.Model.GetMediaCapturePipelineResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.ChimeSDKMediaPipelines.Model.GetMediaCapturePipelineResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMMP.GetCHMMPMediaCapturePipelineCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the MediaPipelineId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^MediaPipelineId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMMP.GetCHMMPMediaCapturePipelineListCmdlet
member.summary: Returns a list of media pipelines.

para.para: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. Valid Range: 1 - 99.
The token used to retrieve the next page of results.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMMP.GetCHMMPMediaCapturePipelineListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'MediaCapturePipelines'. Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.ChimeSDKMediaPipelines.Model.ListMediaCapturePipelinesResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMMP.GetCHMMPResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Lists the tags available for a media pipeline.

para.para: The ARN of the media pipeline associated with any tags. The ARN consists of the pipeline's region, resource ID, and pipeline ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMMP.GetCHMMPResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Tags'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.ChimeSDKMediaPipelines.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.ChimeSDKMediaPipelines.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMMP.NewCHMMPMediaCapturePipelineCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a media pipeline.

para.para: The attendee IDs of the streams selected for a media pipeline.
The unique identifier for the client request. The token makes the API request idempotent. Use a unique token for each media pipeline request.
Defines the layout of the video tiles when content sharing is enabled.
The external user IDs of the streams selected for a media pipeline.
The layout setting, such as GridView in the configuration object.
The MUX type of the audio artifact configuration object.
The MUX type of the artifact configuration.
The MUX type of the video artifact configuration object.
Defines the position of the presenter video tile. Default: TopRight.
The video resolution setting in the configuration object. Default: HD at 1280 x 720. FHD resolution: 1920 x 1080.
The ARN of the sink type.
Destination type to which the media artifacts are saved. You must use an S3 bucket.
ARN of the source from which the media artifacts are captured.
Source type from which the media artifacts are captured. A Chime SDK Meeting is the only supported source.
Indicates whether the content artifact is enabled or disabled.
Indicates whether the video artifact is enabled or disabled.
The tag key-value pairs.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMMP.NewCHMMPMediaCapturePipelineCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'MediaCapturePipeline'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.ChimeSDKMediaPipelines.Model.CreateMediaCapturePipelineResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.ChimeSDKMediaPipelines.Model.CreateMediaCapturePipelineResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMMP.NewCHMMPMediaCapturePipelineCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMMP.NewCHMMPMediaConcatenationPipelineCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a media concatenation pipeline.

para.para: The unique identifier for the client request. The token makes the API request idempotent. Use a unique token for each media concatenation pipeline request.
An object that specifies the data sinks for the media concatenation pipeline.
An object that specifies the sources for the media concatenation pipeline.
The tags associated with the media concatenation pipeline.

The media pipeline's data sources.
The tags associated with the media pipeline.
